column4: i have a clean install of ubuntu 11.04 .. but when i try apt-cache search nginx or varnish
i guess my /etc/apt/sources.list is misconfigured
sudo apt-get update  first
i've done that already.. sources.list only has: deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu natty main
What is the problem exactly?  Packages are missing?
no, i want to install nginx
sudo apt-get install nginx does what?
What does it do?
apt-get install nginx-full
can't find that package either
It's in the universe repo.  Enable it in syanptic.
it's a server at slicehost, no synaptic, ssh access only
Can you pastebin your /etc/apt/sources.list  ?  (you were right!!)
no need to pastebin it, it's one line :) deb http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu natty main
add restricted to the end of that line
whoops
I was wrong: https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories/CommandLine   look at adding repos.  It says you can just add universe ?  I'm not sure.  Read that doc
thanks looking
sure
i assume, i change hardy to natty?
yes of course
yay
yay? :D
